column4: anyone know of an online database of xorg.conf files and associated monitors and vid cards?
I don't think such a database exists; do you need help configuring X?
i do ... I've tried everything google has to offer
well, you're in the right place to ask for help :-)
unfortunately i think it may be hardware specific
that's a somewhat exotic resolution; you're certain your display supports it?
I am not sure if the vid card supports it, but it's the monitors native res
- okay. What video card are you using?
ATI AIW 8500DV
pretty sure I've been through that one, but I'll give it another read
would you put your xorg.conf file in the pastebin please?
it's so hacked apart at this point, it's not worth posting, also it's on another computer with nothing but X
I've not really tinkered with modelines so I'll have a stab at it, it's working on my other computer no prob
I think it is worth posting, especially if it's hacked apart. That might be your problem ;-(
then I gotta install firefox or something to pastebin it
- is installing firefox a problem?
no not really, I was just not wanting to install the extra 30MB
xterm doesn't do copy?
- try selecting text, then middle clicking
ah
- well, it works for me
it launches the now installed fifefox to this page: http://www.libhunspell-1.1-0/
wierdest thing ever, I just middle clicked xterm and it started installing something automatically in the background downloading stuff from ubuntu
- middle click pastes whatever was last selected. whatever was last selected was a install command with a newline
